author: Jacky Wong
title: Hong Kong’s Stock Market Is Running Short of Integrity
text:
Leading lights of the hedge fund world have gathered in Hong Kong to float their big bets on stocks at the annual Sohn conference. One of their biggest challenges: The local market’s setup.
Short sellers see plenty of opportunity to point out underhand behavior in Chinese companies that they argue should cause their shares to fall. At last year’s conference, U.S.-based Muddy Waters suggested shorting furniture-maker Man Wah, while Dan David—CIO of FG Alpha Management—recommended a similar strategy with Dali Foods.
